metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the oval:CheckEnumeration simple type is properly supported for the relationship between the instances of an entity and multiple variable values
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the oval:CheckEnumeration simple type for the relationship between the instances of an entity and multiple variable values.

criterion.comment: Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'all' is supported where all of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'all' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'at least one' is supported where more than one of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'at least one' is supported where one of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'at least one' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'none satisfy' is supported where all of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'none satisfy' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'only one' is supported where more than one of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'only one' is supported where one of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'only one' is supported where none of the individual results are true.

variable_test.comment: Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'all' is supported where all of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'all' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'at least one' is supported where more than one of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'at least one' is supported where one of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'at least one' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'none satisfy' is supported where all of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'none satisfy' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'only one' is supported where more than one of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'only one' is supported where one of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'only one' is supported where none of the individual results are true.

variable_object.comment: This variable_object references a constant_variable that contains the integer values '1', '2', and '3'.

variable_state.comment: This variable_state represents a variable_object where all of the values are greater than all of the integer values '-1', '-2', and '-3'.
This variable_state represents a variable_object where all of the values are less than all of the integer values '-1', '-2', and '-3'
This variable_state represents a variable_object where all of the values are greater than at least one of the integer values '-1', '-2', and '-3'.
This variable_state represents a variable_object where all of the values are equal to at least one of the integer values '1', '2', and '3'.
This variable_state represents a variable_object where all of the values are less than at least one of the integer values '-1', '-2', and '-3'.
This variable_state represents a variable_object where all of the values are not greater than the integer values '-1', '-2', and '-3'.
This variable_state represents a variable_object where all of the values are not less than the integer values '-1', '-2', and '-3'.
This variable_state represents a variable_object where all of the values are greater than only one of the integer values '-1', '-2', and '-3'.
This variable_state represents a variable_object where all of the values are equal to only one of the integer values '1', '2', and '3'.
This variable_state represents a variable_object where all fo the values are less than only one of the integer values '-1', '-2', and '-3'

constant_variable.comment: This constant_variable represents the integer values '1', '2', and '3'.
This constant_variable represents the integer values '-1', '-2', and '-3'.
